category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Are you searching for meaning in your life?
Have you ever felt happiness in your life...
...never lasts?

This Buddhist group has a great positive, multi-cultural atmosphere that helps people search for the answer to life's biggest questions.
Through the teachings of Buddha and historical Pure Land Buddhist teachers we understand better the direction our life needs to take in order to find the purpose of life.
We offer video lectures and have meetings to discuss how to obtain an absolute form of happiness.
I hope you'll stop by and attend a meeting when you have a chance!

Below, you'll find some more information about what Buddhism is all about as well as our contact info and location.
In Buddhism, we learn that there are two kinds of joy.
Relative Happiness All the happiness we know is called Relative Happiness. Money, status, fame, wealth, family, friends, and our loved ones are all included in this category. Politics, economics, medicine, and the arts also try to provide us with Relative happiness. We seek for this type of happiness day in, day out hoping we can attain true satisfaction from it. Absolute Happiness We are all seeking for a happiness which will truly last. This kind of happiness is called Absolute Happiness. The purpose of life is to attain it as quickly as possible while still alive. Learn more at our meetups and check out some of our topics: The Law of Cause and Effect Six Good Deeds that Bring Happiness Mirror of Truth Dark Mind is the Root Cause of Suffering
name: Zürich The purpose of life in Buddhism Meetup
organizer.name: Nobuaki Kondo

Einfach kommen, eine Kerze anzünden, da sein: vor, während, nach dem Gottesdienst.

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Jeden Freitag um 19.00 Uhr
Monolith / Andreaskirche, Brahmsstrasse 106, 8003 Zürich
Verpflegungsmöglichkeit ab 18.00 Uhr

Die eindrückliche und moderne Andreaskirche aka Monolith wird an jedem Freitagabend zum speziellen Feierort: In einem zeitgemässen Gottesdienst geht es um dich und um aktuelle Themen, um Gott und die Welt.

Alle sind willkommen – auch immer Familien mit Kindern. Regelmässig werden Gäste eingeladen, Filmausschnitte gezeigt und Diskussionen geführt.

Die Gottesdienste werden von einem Live-Musik-Trio begleitet, das Gospel singt & spielt und mit den Zuschauern mitsingt. Nina Müller, Sängerin, und Javier Fernandez, Pianist, führen zusätzlich an jedem zweiten Dienstag des Monats den Sing-Workshop "The Joy of Singing" durch.

Einfach kommen, eine Kerze anzünden, da sein: vor, während, nach dem Gottesdienst.

Und vielleicht auch darüber hinaus: Bei uns kannst du dich zu Hause fühlen. Wir machen dir Mut, dich mit deinen Wünschen und Ideen einzubringen und etwas zu bewirken.

Du bist Kirche.

Aktuelle Infos auf facebook.com/sihlfeld
Kontakt: feierwerk@sihlfeld.ch
name: FeierWerk: Dein Gottesdienst am Freitagabend

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Lhagsam Study Group Zurich is dedicated to the study and practice of Tibetan Mahayana Buddhism. Our goal is to bring more peace, balance and happiness not only to our own minds, but also to our immediate environment and ultimately to all universal beings. We meet every Tuesday evening in the heart of Zurich for teachings and instructions, guided meditations and group discussions. Our program also includes talks, day-retreats with qualified teachers, and introduction to meditation courses.

We are affiliated with the Foundation for the Preservation of the Mahayana Tradition (FPMT).

Our website: Zürich.fpmt.ch
name: Lhagsam Tibetan Meditation Study Group
organizer.name: Sandra Passardi

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
The world is a vast and magnificent place, inhabited by wonderful beings of various creeds and beliefs, of different hues and shades and who rely on the abundance mother nature for sustenance and are surrounded by beauty.

Despite such beauty and abundance, not everyone has the luxury of a peaceful and beautiful life; a life of peace and fulfillment, free from hunger, fear and desolation.
Today, millions are suffering from man made disasters resulting in environmental catastrophes, others find themselves amidst chaos and confusion created by wars and conflict, and others are swamped by feelings of helplessness, convinced that there is nothing that can be done.

The organizers of this Meetup believe in the power of prayer; especially the power of praying together for a cause. We believe that a joint prayer can bring healing to an ailing world. Thus, we have created this Meetup.

Join us for good conversation on elevated topics, prayer and deepening on spirituality and self improvement.
Organizers are members of the Baha'i Faith but this event is open to all, including in the events relevant readings and texts from all around the world.
Free of charge.
name: Chat, prayer and meditation

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Our group exists to practice the teachings of the Karma Kagyu tradition of Tibetan Buddhism. The group is part of over 600 centers worldwide and have been inspired and directed by Lama Ole Nydahl. They are under the spiritual guidance of H.H. the 17th Karmapa Trinley Thaye Dorje. 

Our Centers are friendly places where people get an easy access to Buddha’s timeless wisdom, meditate together, share experience and actively participate in the Center activities. We offer daily meditations, meditation courses, retreat places, study courses and lectures by more than 300 international Lay Buddhist Teachers.

 The people you'll meet here are lay (no rules or vows) practitioners with families and jobs who take turns sharing the teachings at public meditations.

Each regular meditation begins with a 20 minute introductory dharma talk and is followed by guided meditation on the Lama. The environment is relaxed and informal and people are welcome to hang out after meditation or come a little earlier. All meetups happen at the Diamond Way Group, Rue de l'Aubépine 3, 6th floor, 1205 Geneva.
Meditations are always free.

For more information visit website: www.bouddhisme.ch
name: Diamond Way Buddhism Meditation Group Geneva
organizer.name: Gretchie Hacquard

category.name: religion/beliefs
description: Are you searching for meaning in your life? Have you ever felt happiness in your life... ...never lasts? This Buddhist group has a great positive, multi-cultural atmosphere that helps people search for the answer to life's biggest questions. Through the teachings of Buddha and historical Pure Land Buddhist teachers we understand better the direction our life needs to take in order to find the purpose of life. We offer video lectures and have meetings to discuss how to obtain an absolute form of happiness. I hope you'll stop by and attend a meeting when you have a chance! Below, you'll find some more information about what Buddhism is all about as well as our contact info and location. In Buddhism, we learn that there are two kinds of joy. Relative Happiness All the happiness we know is called Relative Happiness. Money, status, fame, wealth, family, friends, and our loved ones are all included in this category. Politics, economics, medicine, and the arts also try to provide us with Relative happiness. We seek for this type of happiness day in, day out hoping we can attain true satisfaction from it. Absolute Happiness We are all seeking for a happiness which will truly last. This kind of happiness is called Absolute Happiness. The purpose of life is to attain it as quickly as possible while still alive. Learn more at our meetups and check out some of our topics: The Law of Cause and Effect Six Good Deeds that Bring Happiness Mirror of Truth Dark Mind is the Root Cause of Suffering
name: Lausanne The purpose of life in Buddhism Meetup
organizer.name: Nobuaki Kondo

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Hey guys,

I've had this idea of creating this group of people who have a passion for Truth. It'll be a group where people of all kinds of beliefs, faiths and ideas could join in order to discuss about these issues. I am a Christian but let me be clear that I've lived in 4 different countries, embraced multiple and various cultures. My vision would be to create a group where anyone who has an interest in this subject can come and discuss about these issues openly, and honestly without no one judging them whatsoever.

It's basically promoting interfaith dialogue. It would be amazing to see people from various backgrounds (Muslims, Christians, Atheists, Buddhists, Hindous, Agnostics...) join in to discuss about issues and have a good time over a meal or a drink.

Best,
name: Quest for Truth - Interfaith Dialogue
organizer.name: Vahé Jebejian

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
This year marks the 200th year anniversary of the birth of Baha'u'llah, one of the most influential personalities of our time. The progressive principles he espoused in 19th century Persia moved many individuals to challenge the conceptions of their time and to live a life characterized by disinterested service to their communities. Their endeavours formed the premise of what is now called “social action”.

The political and religious leaders of the time, fearing his influence, exiled him many times with the hope of eliminating his impact. Today, however, inspired by his teachings, millions of people around the world are striving to put his ideals into practice and their efforts are effecting a social change in every sphere of human society.

“The world is but one country and mankind its citizens", he said in one of his most famous quotes. And further, “[l]et your vision be world-embracing, rather than confined to your own self.” Come and find out about a personage whose teachings are contributing to a gradual and significant change in the world. The evening will include an introduction to the life and mission of Baha'u'llah and a film on the concrete actions taken by individuals to bring positive changes to their communities based on his teachings. 

“Let their glorious, peace-bringing, love-creating words and lessons sink into your hearts…”  

- Queen Marie of Romania (1875 – 1938), regarding the teachings of Baha'u'llah
name: Introduction to the Life and Mission of Baha’u’llah
organizer.name: Simin

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Are you searching for meaning in your life?
Have you ever felt happiness in your life...
...never lasts?

This Buddhist group has a great positive, multi-cultural atmosphere that helps people search for the answer to life's biggest questions.
Through the teachings of Buddha and historical Pure Land Buddhist teachers we understand better the direction our life needs to take in order to find the purpose of life.
We offer video lectures and have meetings to discuss how to obtain an absolute form of happiness.
I hope you'll stop by and attend a meeting when you have a chance!

Below, you'll find some more information about what Buddhism is all about as well as our contact info and location.
In Buddhism, we learn that there are two kinds of joy.
Relative Happiness All the happiness we know is called Relative Happiness. Money, status, fame, wealth, family, friends, and our loved ones are all included in this category. Politics, economics, medicine, and the arts also try to provide us with Relative happiness. We seek for this type of happiness day in, day out hoping we can attain true satisfaction from it. Absolute Happiness We are all seeking for a happiness which will truly last. This kind of happiness is called Absolute Happiness. The purpose of life is to attain it as quickly as possible while still alive. Learn more at our meetups and check out some of our topics: The Law of Cause and Effect Six Good Deeds that Bring Happiness Mirror of Truth Dark Mind is the Root Cause of Suffering
name: Zürich The purpose of life in Buddhism Meetup
organizer.name: Nobuaki Kondo

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Jeden Freitag um 19.00 Uhr
Monolith / Andreaskirche, Brahmsstrasse 106, 8003 Zürich
Verpflegungsmöglichkeit ab 18.00 Uhr

Die eindrückliche und moderne Andreaskirche aka Monolith wird an jedem Freitagabend zum speziellen Feierort: In einem zeitgemässen Gottesdienst geht es um dich und um aktuelle Themen, um Gott und die Welt.

Alle sind willkommen – auch immer Familien mit Kindern. Regelmässig werden Gäste eingeladen, Filmausschnitte gezeigt und Diskussionen geführt.

Die Gottesdienste werden von einem Live-Musik-Trio begleitet, das Gospel singt & spielt und mit den Zuschauern mitsingt. Nina Müller, Sängerin, und Javier Fernandez, Pianist, führen zusätzlich an jedem zweiten Dienstag des Monats den Sing-Workshop "The Joy of Singing" durch.

Einfach kommen, eine Kerze anzünden, da sein: vor, während, nach dem Gottesdienst.

Und vielleicht auch darüber hinaus: Bei uns kannst du dich zu Hause fühlen. Wir machen dir Mut, dich mit deinen Wünschen und Ideen einzubringen und etwas zu bewirken.

Du bist Kirche.

Aktuelle Infos auf facebook.com/sihlfeld
Kontakt: feierwerk@sihlfeld.ch
name: FeierWerk: Dein Gottesdienst am Freitagabend

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Lhagsam Study Group Zurich is dedicated to the study and practice of Tibetan Mahayana Buddhism. Our goal is to bring more peace, balance and happiness not only to our own minds, but also to our immediate environment and ultimately to all universal beings. We meet every Tuesday evening in the heart of Zurich for teachings and instructions, guided meditations and group discussions. Our program also includes talks, day-retreats with qualified teachers, and introduction to meditation courses.

We are affiliated with the Foundation for the Preservation of the Mahayana Tradition (FPMT).

Our website: Zürich.fpmt.ch
name: Lhagsam Tibetan Meditation Study Group
organizer.name: Sandra Passardi

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
The world is a vast and magnificent place, inhabited by wonderful beings of various creeds and beliefs, of different hues and shades and who rely on the abundance mother nature for sustenance and are surrounded by beauty.

Despite such beauty and abundance, not everyone has the luxury of a peaceful and beautiful life; a life of peace and fulfillment, free from hunger, fear and desolation.
Today, millions are suffering from man made disasters resulting in environmental catastrophes, others find themselves amidst chaos and confusion created by wars and conflict, and others are swamped by feelings of helplessness, convinced that there is nothing that can be done.

The organizers of this Meetup believe in the power of prayer; especially the power of praying together for a cause. We believe that a joint prayer can bring healing to an ailing world. Thus, we have created this Meetup.

Join us for good conversation on elevated topics, prayer and deepening on spirituality and self improvement.
Organizers are members of the Baha'i Faith but this event is open to all, including in the events relevant readings and texts from all around the world.
Free of charge.
name: Chat, prayer and meditation

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Hey guys,

I've had this idea of creating this group of people who have a passion for Truth. It'll be a group where people of all kinds of beliefs, faiths and ideas could join in order to discuss about these issues. I am a Christian but let me be clear that I've lived in 4 different countries, embraced multiple and various cultures. My vision would be to create a group where anyone who has an interest in this subject can come and discuss about these issues openly, and honestly without no one judging them whatsoever.

It's basically promoting interfaith dialogue. It would be amazing to see people from various backgrounds (Muslims, Christians, Atheists, Buddhists, Hindous, Agnostics...) join in to discuss about issues and have a good time over a meal or a drink.

Best,
name: Quest for Truth - Interfaith Dialogue
organizer.name: Vahé Jebejian

Die Gottesdienste werden von einem Live-Musik-Trio begleitet, das Gospel singt & spielt und mit den Zuschauern mitsingt. Nina Müller, Sängerin, und Javier Fernandez, Pianist, führen zusätzlich an jedem zweiten Dienstag des Monats den Sing-Workshop "The Joy of Singing" durch.

Einfach kommen, eine Kerze anzünden, da sein: vor, während, nach dem Gottesdienst.

Und vielleicht auch darüber hinaus: Bei uns kannst du dich zu Hause fühlen. Wir machen dir Mut, dich mit deinen Wünschen und Ideen einzubringen und etwas zu bewirken.

Du bist Kirche.

Aktuelle Infos auf facebook.com/sihlfeld
Kontakt: feierwerk@sihlfeld.ch

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Lhagsam Study Group Zurich is dedicated to the study and practice of Tibetan Mahayana Buddhism. Our goal is to bring more peace, balance and happiness not only to our own minds, but also to our immediate environment and ultimately to all universal beings. We meet every Tuesday evening in the heart of Zurich for teachings and instructions, guided meditations and group discussions. Our program also includes talks, day-retreats with qualified teachers, and introduction to meditation courses.

We are affiliated with the Foundation for the Preservation of the Mahayana Tradition (FPMT).

Our website: Zürich.fpmt.ch

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
The world is a vast and magnificent place, inhabited by wonderful beings of various creeds and beliefs, of different hues and shades and who rely on the abundance mother nature for sustenance and are surrounded by beauty.

Despite such beauty and abundance, not everyone has the luxury of a peaceful and beautiful life; a life of peace and fulfillment, free from hunger, fear and desolation.
Today, millions are suffering from man made disasters resulting in environmental catastrophes, others find themselves amidst chaos and confusion created by wars and conflict, and others are swamped by feelings of helplessness, convinced that there is nothing that can be done.

The organizers of this Meetup believe in the power of prayer; especially the power of praying together for a cause. We believe that a joint prayer can bring healing to an ailing world. Thus, we have created this Meetup.

Join us for good conversation on elevated topics, prayer and deepening on spirituality and self improvement.
Organizers are members of the Baha'i Faith but this event is open to all, including in the events relevant readings and texts from all around the world.
Free of charge.
name: Chat, prayer and meditation

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Are you searching for meaning in your life?
Have you ever felt happiness in your life...
...never lasts?

This Buddhist group has a great positive, multi-cultural atmosphere that helps people search for the answer to life's biggest questions.
Through the teachings of Buddha and historical Pure Land Buddhist teachers we understand better the direction our life needs to take in order to find the purpose of life.
We offer video lectures and have meetings to discuss how to obtain an absolute form of happiness.
I hope you'll stop by and attend a meeting when you have a chance!

Below, you'll find some more information about what Buddhism is all about as well as our contact info and location.
In Buddhism, we learn that there are two kinds of joy.
Relative Happiness All the happiness we know is called Relative Happiness. Money, status, fame, wealth, family, friends, and our loved ones are all included in this category. Politics, economics, medicine, and the arts also try to provide us with Relative happiness. We seek for this type of happiness day in, day out hoping we can attain true satisfaction from it. Absolute Happiness We are all seeking for a happiness which will truly last. This kind of happiness is called Absolute Happiness. The purpose of life is to attain it as quickly as possible while still alive. Learn more at our meetups and check out some of our topics: The Law of Cause and Effect Six Good Deeds that Bring Happiness Mirror of Truth Dark Mind is the Root Cause of Suffering
name: Zürich The purpose of life in Buddhism Meetup
organizer.name: Nobuaki Kondo

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Unitarian Universalism is a liberal religion characterized by our free and responsible search for truth and meaning. Thus it is not a religion that tells you what to believe, how to behave, or what God is, but rather strives to encourage its members to answer these questions in their own unique ways. Some say that we are a reformed church that never stopped reforming. We are supported by resources from the Unitarian Universalist Association, European Unitarian Universalists, and the Church of the Larger Fellowship as well as many individual churches and leaders around the world.

In Switzerland, there are UU groups in Geneva and Basel. In Bern, we are not (at this point) forming another congregation, but rather have created a Chalice Circle, that is a small group of individuals who gather once per month. Usually one person sets a theme, chooses an opening and a closing reading, and hosts the meeting. The others are invited to bring questions, songs, thoughts, objects, reading, images, or anything else to create a collective spiritual space. The service is a mix of discussion, silence, listening, and reflection in an improvisational format. No one is required to do anything besides respect the other members but everyone is invited to contribute to and help shape the service. Up until now, we have held all of our services in English, but multilingualism is welcome. We are currently working our way through the UU principles, below, to create a foundation of a shared understanding.

Please visit our website for more information, details, and to get in touch.
name: Unitarian Universalist Chalice Circle of Bern, Switzerland
organizer.name: Natalie Ceperley

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Für alle die interessiert sind mehr über Ansichten, Praxis und Rituale im tibetischen Buddhismus zu erfahren, und wie man diese Praktiken im eigenen Leben anwenden kann.

Wir sind ein tibetisch buddhistisches Zentrum, das der FPMT (foundation for the preservation of Mahayana Buddhism) angehört. Wir stehen unter der Schirmherrschaft von SH Dalai Lama und unser spiritueller Leiter ist Kyabje Zopa Rinpoche.
Wir bieten ein breites Spektrum tibetisch buddhistischer Praktiken, sowie auch Meditationsabende, (Konzentration und Kontemplation), Belehrungen von ordinierten tibetischen und westlichen, sowie auch von Laienlehrern.
Wir sehen es nicht als unsere Aufgabe die Menschen zum Buddhismus zu konvertieren, sondern möchten diese wertvollen und wirksamen Methoden, wie wir unser Herz ohne Angst öffnen können, mit allen teilen die daran interessiert sind.
Alle Anlässe finden auf Spendenbasis statt, und jeder ist willkommen.
name: Bern Tibetan Buddhism Longku FPMT Meetup
organizer.name: Rita Riniker

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Are you searching for meaning in your life?
Have you ever felt happiness in your life...
...never lasts?

This Buddhist group has a great positive, multi-cultural atmosphere that helps people search for the answer to life's biggest questions.
Through the teachings of Buddha and historical Pure Land Buddhist teachers we understand better the direction our life needs to take in order to find the purpose of life.
We offer video lectures and have meetings to discuss how to obtain an absolute form of happiness.
I hope you'll stop by and attend a meeting when you have a chance!

Below, you'll find some more information about what Buddhism is all about as well as our contact info and location.
In Buddhism, we learn that there are two kinds of joy.
Relative Happiness All the happiness we know is called Relative Happiness. Money, status, fame, wealth, family, friends, and our loved ones are all included in this category. Politics, economics, medicine, and the arts also try to provide us with Relative happiness. We seek for this type of happiness day in, day out hoping we can attain true satisfaction from it. Absolute Happiness We are all seeking for a happiness which will truly last. This kind of happiness is called Absolute Happiness. The purpose of life is to attain it as quickly as possible while still alive. Learn more at our meetups and check out some of our topics: The Law of Cause and Effect Six Good Deeds that Bring Happiness Mirror of Truth Dark Mind is the Root Cause of Suffering
name: Zürich The purpose of life in Buddhism Meetup
organizer.name: Nobuaki Kondo

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Jeden Freitag um 19.00 Uhr
Monolith / Andreaskirche, Brahmsstrasse 106, 8003 Zürich
Verpflegungsmöglichkeit ab 18.00 Uhr

Die eindrückliche und moderne Andreaskirche aka Monolith wird an jedem Freitagabend zum speziellen Feierort: In einem zeitgemässen Gottesdienst geht es um dich und um aktuelle Themen, um Gott und die Welt.

Alle sind willkommen – auch immer Familien mit Kindern. Regelmässig werden Gäste eingeladen, Filmausschnitte gezeigt und Diskussionen geführt.

Die Gottesdienste werden von einem Live-Musik-Trio begleitet, das Gospel singt & spielt und mit den Zuschauern mitsingt. Nina Müller, Sängerin, und Javier Fernandez, Pianist, führen zusätzlich an jedem zweiten Dienstag des Monats den Sing-Workshop "The Joy of Singing" durch.

Einfach kommen, eine Kerze anzünden, da sein: vor, während, nach dem Gottesdienst.

Und vielleicht auch darüber hinaus: Bei uns kannst du dich zu Hause fühlen. Wir machen dir Mut, dich mit deinen Wünschen und Ideen einzubringen und etwas zu bewirken.

Du bist Kirche.

Aktuelle Infos auf facebook.com/sihlfeld
Kontakt: feierwerk@sihlfeld.ch
name: FeierWerk: Dein Gottesdienst am Freitagabend

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Lhagsam Study Group Zurich is dedicated to the study and practice of Tibetan Mahayana Buddhism. Our goal is to bring more peace, balance and happiness not only to our own minds, but also to our immediate environment and ultimately to all universal beings. We meet every Tuesday evening in the heart of Zurich for teachings and instructions, guided meditations and group discussions. Our program also includes talks, day-retreats with qualified teachers, and introduction to meditation courses.

We are affiliated with the Foundation for the Preservation of the Mahayana Tradition (FPMT).

Our website: Zürich.fpmt.ch
name: Lhagsam Tibetan Meditation Study Group
organizer.name: Sandra Passardi

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
The world is a vast and magnificent place, inhabited by wonderful beings of various creeds and beliefs, of different hues and shades and who rely on the abundance mother nature for sustenance and are surrounded by beauty.

Despite such beauty and abundance, not everyone has the luxury of a peaceful and beautiful life; a life of peace and fulfillment, free from hunger, fear and desolation.
Today, millions are suffering from man made disasters resulting in environmental catastrophes, others find themselves amidst chaos and confusion created by wars and conflict, and others are swamped by feelings of helplessness, convinced that there is nothing that can be done.

The organizers of this Meetup believe in the power of prayer; especially the power of praying together for a cause. We believe that a joint prayer can bring healing to an ailing world. Thus, we have created this Meetup.

Join us for good conversation on elevated topics, prayer and deepening on spirituality and self improvement.
Organizers are members of the Baha'i Faith but this event is open to all, including in the events relevant readings and texts from all around the world.
Free of charge.
name: Chat, prayer and meditation

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Basel Unitarian Universalists hosted a successful European wide retreat last April, and one of the best received workshops was an interfaith panel discussion which included an Imam, a Rabbi, and a Pagan. We are launching a series of follow-on discussions locally and invite Meet-up members to join a discussion about "The Inherent Worth and Dignity of Every Person" and how is it expressed in your religion or belief system.

Religious values do not need to be in conflict with humanistic values, in our view. Whether you agree or not with this premise please join us for a respectful dialogue.
name: Celebrating Religious Diversity in Basel
organizer.name: Matt Gilsenan

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Unitarian Universalism is a liberal religion characterized by our free and responsible search for truth and meaning. Thus it is not a religion that tells you what to believe, how to behave, or what God is, but rather strives to encourage its members to answer these questions in their own unique ways. Some say that we are a reformed church that never stopped reforming. We are supported by resources from the Unitarian Universalist Association, European Unitarian Universalists, and the Church of the Larger Fellowship as well as many individual churches and leaders around the world.

In Switzerland, there are UU groups in Geneva and Basel. In Bern, we are not (at this point) forming another congregation, but rather have created a Chalice Circle, that is a small group of individuals who gather once per month. Usually one person sets a theme, chooses an opening and a closing reading, and hosts the meeting. The others are invited to bring questions, songs, thoughts, objects, reading, images, or anything else to create a collective spiritual space. The service is a mix of discussion, silence, listening, and reflection in an improvisational format. No one is required to do anything besides respect the other members but everyone is invited to contribute to and help shape the service. Up until now, we have held all of our services in English, but multilingualism is welcome. We are currently working our way through the UU principles, below, to create a foundation of a shared understanding.

Please visit our website for more information, details, and to get in touch.
name: Unitarian Universalist Chalice Circle of Bern, Switzerland
organizer.name: Natalie Ceperley

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Are you searching for meaning in your life?
Have you ever felt happiness in your life...
...never lasts?

This Buddhist group has a great positive, multi-cultural atmosphere that helps people search for the answer to life's biggest questions.
Through the teachings of Buddha and historical Pure Land Buddhist teachers we understand better the direction our life needs to take in order to find the purpose of life.
We offer video lectures and have meetings to discuss how to obtain an absolute form of happiness.
I hope you'll stop by and attend a meeting when you have a chance!

Below, you'll find some more information about what Buddhism is all about as well as our contact info and location.
In Buddhism, we learn that there are two kinds of joy.
Relative Happiness All the happiness we know is called Relative Happiness. Money, status, fame, wealth, family, friends, and our loved ones are all included in this category. Politics, economics, medicine, and the arts also try to provide us with Relative happiness. We seek for this type of happiness day in, day out hoping we can attain true satisfaction from it. Absolute Happiness We are all seeking for a happiness which will truly last. This kind of happiness is called Absolute Happiness. The purpose of life is to attain it as quickly as possible while still alive. Learn more at our meetups and check out some of our topics: The Law of Cause and Effect Six Good Deeds that Bring Happiness Mirror of Truth Dark Mind is the Root Cause of Suffering
name: Zürich The purpose of life in Buddhism Meetup
organizer.name: Nobuaki Kondo

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Jeden Freitag um 19.00 Uhr
Monolith / Andreaskirche, Brahmsstrasse 106, 8003 Zürich
Verpflegungsmöglichkeit ab 18.00 Uhr

Die eindrückliche und moderne Andreaskirche aka Monolith wird an jedem Freitagabend zum speziellen Feierort: In einem zeitgemässen Gottesdienst geht es um dich und um aktuelle Themen, um Gott und die Welt.

Alle sind willkommen – auch immer Familien mit Kindern. Regelmässig werden Gäste eingeladen, Filmausschnitte gezeigt und Diskussionen geführt.

Die Gottesdienste werden von einem Live-Musik-Trio begleitet, das Gospel singt & spielt und mit den Zuschauern mitsingt. Nina Müller, Sängerin, und Javier Fernandez, Pianist, führen zusätzlich an jedem zweiten Dienstag des Monats den Sing-Workshop "The Joy of Singing" durch.

Einfach kommen, eine Kerze anzünden, da sein: vor, während, nach dem Gottesdienst.

Und vielleicht auch darüber hinaus: Bei uns kannst du dich zu Hause fühlen. Wir machen dir Mut, dich mit deinen Wünschen und Ideen einzubringen und etwas zu bewirken.

Du bist Kirche.

Aktuelle Infos auf facebook.com/sihlfeld
Kontakt: feierwerk@sihlfeld.ch
name: FeierWerk: Dein Gottesdienst am Freitagabend

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Lhagsam Study Group Zurich is dedicated to the study and practice of Tibetan Mahayana Buddhism. Our goal is to bring more peace, balance and happiness not only to our own minds, but also to our immediate environment and ultimately to all universal beings. We meet every Tuesday evening in the heart of Zurich for teachings and instructions, guided meditations and group discussions. Our program also includes talks, day-retreats with qualified teachers, and introduction to meditation courses.

We are affiliated with the Foundation for the Preservation of the Mahayana Tradition (FPMT).

Our website: Zürich.fpmt.ch
name: Lhagsam Tibetan Meditation Study Group
organizer.name: Sandra Passardi

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
The world is a vast and magnificent place, inhabited by wonderful beings of various creeds and beliefs, of different hues and shades and who rely on the abundance mother nature for sustenance and are surrounded by beauty.

Despite such beauty and abundance, not everyone has the luxury of a peaceful and beautiful life; a life of peace and fulfillment, free from hunger, fear and desolation.
Today, millions are suffering from man made disasters resulting in environmental catastrophes, others find themselves amidst chaos and confusion created by wars and conflict, and others are swamped by feelings of helplessness, convinced that there is nothing that can be done.

The organizers of this Meetup believe in the power of prayer; especially the power of praying together for a cause. We believe that a joint prayer can bring healing to an ailing world. Thus, we have created this Meetup.

Join us for good conversation on elevated topics, prayer and deepening on spirituality and self improvement.
Organizers are members of the Baha'i Faith but this event is open to all, including in the events relevant readings and texts from all around the world.
Free of charge.
name: Chat, prayer and meditation

The purpose of life is to attain it as quickly as possible while still alive.
Learn more at our meetups and check out some of our topics: The Law of Cause and Effect Six Good Deeds that Bring Happiness Mirror of Truth Dark Mind is the Root Cause of Suffering

description:

We are launching a series of follow-on discussions locally and invite Meet-up members to join a discussion about "The Inherent Worth and Dignity of Every Person" and how is it expressed in your religion or belief system.

Religious values do not need to be in conflict with humanistic values, in our view. Whether you agree or not with this premise please join us for a respectful dialogue.
name: Celebrating Religious Diversity in Basel

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Unitarian Universalism is a liberal religion characterized by our free and responsible search for truth and meaning. Thus it is not a religion that tells you what to believe, how to behave, or what God is, but rather strives to encourage its members to answer these questions in their own unique ways. Some say that we are a reformed church that never stopped reforming. We are supported by resources from the Unitarian Universalist Association, European Unitarian Universalists, and the Church of the Larger Fellowship as well as many individual churches and leaders around the world.

In Switzerland, there are UU groups in Geneva and Basel. In Bern, we are not (at this point) forming another congregation, but rather have created a Chalice Circle, that is a small group of individuals who gather once per month. Usually one person sets a theme, chooses an opening and a closing reading, and hosts the meeting. The others are invited to bring questions, songs, thoughts, objects, reading, images, or anything else to create a collective spiritual space. The service is a mix of discussion, silence, listening, and reflection in an improvisational format. No one is required to do anything besides respect the other members but everyone is invited to contribute to and help shape the service. Up until now, we have held all of our services in English, but multilingualism is welcome. We are currently working our way through the UU principles, below, to create a foundation of a shared understanding.

Please visit our website for more information, details, and to get in touch.
name: Unitarian Universalist Chalice Circle of Bern, Switzerland
organizer.name: Natalie Ceperley

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Für alle die interessiert sind mehr über Ansichten, Praxis und Rituale im tibetischen Buddhismus zu erfahren, und wie man diese Praktiken im eigenen Leben anwenden kann.

Wir sind ein tibetisch buddhistisches Zentrum, das der FPMT (foundation for the preservation of Mahayana Buddhism) angehört. Wir stehen unter der Schirmherrschaft von SH Dalai Lama und unser spiritueller Leiter ist Kyabje Zopa Rinpoche.
Wir bieten ein breites Spektrum tibetisch buddhistischer Praktiken, sowie auch Meditationsabende, (Konzentration und Kontemplation), Belehrungen von ordinierten tibetischen und westlichen, sowie auch von Laienlehrern.
Wir sehen es nicht als unsere Aufgabe die Menschen zum Buddhismus zu konvertieren, sondern möchten diese wertvollen und wirksamen Methoden, wie wir unser Herz ohne Angst öffnen können, mit allen teilen die daran interessiert sind.
Alle Anlässe finden auf Spendenbasis statt, und jeder ist willkommen.
name: Bern Tibetan Buddhism Longku FPMT Meetup
organizer.name: Rita Riniker

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Are you searching for meaning in your life?
Have you ever felt happiness in your life...
...never lasts?

This Buddhist group has a great positive, multi-cultural atmosphere that helps people search for the answer to life's biggest questions.
Through the teachings of Buddha and historical Pure Land Buddhist teachers we understand better the direction our life needs to take in order to find the purpose of life.
We offer video lectures and have meetings to discuss how to obtain an absolute form of happiness.
I hope you'll stop by and attend a meeting when you have a chance!

Below, you'll find some more information about what Buddhism is all about as well as our contact info and location.
In Buddhism, we learn that there are two kinds of joy.
Relative Happiness All the happiness we know is called Relative Happiness. Money, status, fame, wealth, family, friends, and our loved ones are all included in this category. Politics, economics, medicine, and the arts also try to provide us with Relative happiness. We seek for this type of happiness day in, day out hoping we can attain true satisfaction from it. Absolute Happiness We are all seeking for a happiness which will truly last. This kind of happiness is called Absolute Happiness. The purpose of life is to attain it as quickly as possible while still alive. Learn more at our meetups and check out some of our topics: The Law of Cause and Effect Six Good Deeds that Bring Happiness Mirror of Truth Dark Mind is the Root Cause of Suffering
name: Zürich The purpose of life in Buddhism Meetup

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Jeden Freitag um 19.00 Uhr
Monolith / Andreaskirche, Brahmsstrasse 106, 8003 Zürich
Verpflegungsmöglichkeit ab 18.00 Uhr

Die eindrückliche und moderne Andreaskirche aka Monolith wird an jedem Freitagabend zum speziellen Feierort: In einem zeitgemässen Gottesdienst geht es um dich und um aktuelle Themen, um Gott und die Welt.

Alle sind willkommen – auch immer Familien mit Kindern. Regelmässig werden Gäste eingeladen, Filmausschnitte gezeigt und Diskussionen geführt.

Die Gottesdienste werden von einem Live-Musik-Trio begleitet, das Gospel singt & spielt und mit den Zuschauern mitsingt. Nina Müller, Sängerin, und Javier Fernandez, Pianist, führen zusätzlich an jedem zweiten Dienstag des Monats den Sing-Workshop "The Joy of Singing" durch.

Einfach kommen, eine Kerze anzünden, da sein: vor, während, nach dem Gottesdienst.

Und vielleicht auch darüber hinaus: Bei uns kannst du dich zu Hause fühlen. Wir machen dir Mut, dich mit deinen Wünschen und Ideen einzubringen und etwas zu bewirken.

Du bist Kirche.

Aktuelle Infos auf facebook.com/sihlfeld
Kontakt: feierwerk@sihlfeld.ch
name: FeierWerk: Dein Gottesdienst am Freitagabend
organizer.name: Thomas

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Lhagsam Study Group Zurich is dedicated to the study and practice of Tibetan Mahayana Buddhism. Our goal is to bring more peace, balance and happiness not only to our own minds, but also to our immediate environment and ultimately to all universal beings. We meet every Tuesday evening in the heart of Zurich for teachings and instructions, guided meditations and group discussions. Our program also includes talks, day-retreats with qualified teachers, and introduction to meditation courses.

We are affiliated with the Foundation for the Preservation of the Mahayana Tradition (FPMT).

Our website: Zürich.fpmt.ch
name: Lhagsam Tibetan Meditation Study Group

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
The world is a vast and magnificent place, inhabited by wonderful beings of various creeds and beliefs, of different hues and shades and who rely on the abundance mother nature for sustenance and are surrounded by beauty.

Despite such beauty and abundance, not everyone has the luxury of a peaceful and beautiful life; a life of peace and fulfillment, free from hunger, fear and desolation.
Today, millions are suffering from man made disasters resulting in environmental catastrophes, others find themselves amidst chaos and confusion created by wars and conflict, and others are swamped by feelings of helplessness, convinced that there is nothing that can be done.

The organizers of this Meetup believe in the power of prayer; especially the power of praying together for a cause. We believe that a joint prayer can bring healing to an ailing world. Thus, we have created this Meetup.

Join us for good conversation on elevated topics, prayer and deepening on spirituality and self improvement.
Organizers are members of the Baha'i Faith but this event is open to all, including in the events relevant readings and texts from all around the world.
Free of charge.
name: Chat, prayer and meditation

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Unitarian Universalism is a liberal religion characterized by our free and responsible search for truth and meaning. Thus it is not a religion that tells you what to believe, how to behave, or what God is, but rather strives to encourage its members to answer these questions in their own unique ways. Some say that we are a reformed church that never stopped reforming. We are supported by resources from the Unitarian Universalist Association, European Unitarian Universalists, and the Church of the Larger Fellowship as well as many individual churches and leaders around the world.

In Switzerland, there are UU groups in Geneva and Basel. In Bern, we are not (at this point) forming another congregation, but rather have created a Chalice Circle, that is a small group of individuals who gather once per month. Usually one person sets a theme, chooses an opening and a closing reading, and hosts the meeting. The others are invited to bring questions, songs, thoughts, objects, reading, images, or anything else to create a collective spiritual space. The service is a mix of discussion, silence, listening, and reflection in an improvisational format. No one is required to do anything besides respect the other members but everyone is invited to contribute to and help shape the service. Up until now, we have held all of our services in English, but multilingualism is welcome. We are currently working our way through the UU principles, below, to create a foundation of a shared understanding.

Please visit our website for more information, details, and to get in touch.
name: Unitarian Universalist Chalice Circle of Bern, Switzerland
organizer.name: Natalie Ceperley

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Für alle die interessiert sind mehr über Ansichten, Praxis und Rituale im tibetischen Buddhismus zu erfahren, und wie man diese Praktiken im eigenen Leben anwenden kann.

Wir sind ein tibetisch buddhistisches Zentrum, das der FPMT (foundation for the preservation of Mahayana Buddhism) angehört. Wir stehen unter der Schirmherrschaft von SH Dalai Lama und unser spiritueller Leiter ist Kyabje Zopa Rinpoche.
Wir bieten ein breites Spektrum tibetisch buddhistischer Praktiken, sowie auch Meditationsabende, (Konzentration und Kontemplation), Belehrungen von ordinierten tibetischen und westlichen, sowie auch von Laienlehrern.
Wir sehen es nicht als unsere Aufgabe die Menschen zum Buddhismus zu konvertieren, sondern möchten diese wertvollen und wirksamen Methoden, wie wir unser Herz ohne Angst öffnen können, mit allen teilen die daran interessiert sind.
Alle Anlässe finden auf Spendenbasis statt, und jeder ist willkommen.
name: Bern Tibetan Buddhism Longku FPMT Meetup
organizer.name: Rita Riniker

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Are you searching for meaning in your life?
Have you ever felt happiness in your life...
...never lasts?

This Buddhist group has a great positive, multi-cultural atmosphere that helps people search for the answer to life's biggest questions.
Through the teachings of Buddha and historical Pure Land Buddhist teachers we understand better the direction our life needs to take in order to find the purpose of life.
We offer video lectures and have meetings to discuss how to obtain an absolute form of happiness.
I hope you'll stop by and attend a meeting when you have a chance!

Below, you'll find some more information about what Buddhism is all about as well as our contact info and location.
In Buddhism, we learn that there are two kinds of joy.
Relative Happiness All the happiness we know is called Relative Happiness. Money, status, fame, wealth, family, friends, and our loved ones are all included in this category. Politics, economics, medicine, and the arts also try to provide us with Relative happiness. We seek for this type of happiness day in, day out hoping we can attain true satisfaction from it. Absolute Happiness We are all seeking for a happiness which will truly last. This kind of happiness is called Absolute Happiness. The purpose of life is to attain it as quickly as possible while still alive. Learn more at our meetups and check out some of our topics: The Law of Cause and Effect Six Good Deeds that Bring Happiness Mirror of Truth Dark Mind is the Root Cause of Suffering
name: Zürich The purpose of life in Buddhism Meetup
organizer.name: Nobuaki Kondo

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Jeden Freitag um 19.00 Uhr
Monolith / Andreaskirche, Brahmsstrasse 106, 8003 Zürich
Verpflegungsmöglichkeit ab 18.00 Uhr

Die eindrückliche und moderne Andreaskirche aka Monolith wird an jedem Freitagabend zum speziellen Feierort: In einem zeitgemässen Gottesdienst geht es um dich und um aktuelle Themen, um Gott und die Welt.

Alle sind willkommen – auch immer Familien mit Kindern. Regelmässig werden Gäste eingeladen, Filmausschnitte gezeigt und Diskussionen geführt.

Die Gottesdienste werden von einem Live-Musik-Trio begleitet, das Gospel singt & spielt und mit den Zuschauern mitsingt. Nina Müller, Sängerin, und Javier Fernandez, Pianist, führen zusätzlich an jedem zweiten Dienstag des Monats den Sing-Workshop "The Joy of Singing" durch.

Einfach kommen, eine Kerze anzünden, da sein: vor, während, nach dem Gottesdienst.

Und vielleicht auch darüber hinaus: Bei uns kannst du dich zu Hause fühlen. Wir machen dir Mut, dich mit deinen Wünschen und Ideen einzubringen und etwas zu bewirken.

Du bist Kirche.

Aktuelle Infos auf facebook.com/sihlfeld
Kontakt: feierwerk@sihlfeld.ch
name: FeierWerk: Dein Gottesdienst am Freitagabend

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Lhagsam Study Group Zurich is dedicated to the study and practice of Tibetan Mahayana Buddhism. Our goal is to bring more peace, balance and happiness not only to our own minds, but also to our immediate environment and ultimately to all universal beings. We meet every Tuesday evening in the heart of Zurich for teachings and instructions, guided meditations and group discussions. Our program also includes talks, day-retreats with qualified teachers, and introduction to meditation courses.

We are affiliated with the Foundation for the Preservation of the Mahayana Tradition (FPMT).

Our website: Zürich.fpmt.ch
name: Lhagsam Tibetan Meditation Study Group

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
The world is a vast and magnificent place, inhabited by wonderful beings of various creeds and beliefs, of different hues and shades and who rely on the abundance mother nature for sustenance and are surrounded by beauty.

Despite such beauty and abundance, not everyone has the luxury of a peaceful and beautiful life; a life of peace and fulfillment, free from hunger, fear and desolation.
Today, millions are suffering from man made disasters resulting in environmental catastrophes, others find themselves amidst chaos and confusion created by wars and conflict, and others are swamped by feelings of helplessness, convinced that there is nothing that can be done.

The organizers of this Meetup believe in the power of prayer; especially the power of praying together for a cause. We believe that a joint prayer can bring healing to an ailing world. Thus, we have created this Meetup.

Join us for good conversation on elevated topics, prayer and deepening on spirituality and self improvement.
Organizers are members of the Baha'i Faith but this event is open to all, including in the events relevant readings and texts from all around the world.
Free of charge.
name: Chat, prayer and meditation

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Hey guys,

I've had this idea of creating this group of people who have a passion for Truth. It'll be a group where people of all kinds of beliefs, faiths and ideas could join in order to discuss about these issues. I am a Christian but let me be clear that I've lived in 4 different countries, embraced multiple and various cultures. My vision would be to create a group where anyone who has an interest in this subject can come and discuss about these issues openly, and honestly without no one judging them whatsoever.

It's basically promoting interfaith dialogue. It would be amazing to see people from various backgrounds (Muslims, Christians, Atheists, Buddhists, Hindous, Agnostics...) join in to discuss about issues and have a good time over a meal or a drink.

Best,
name: Quest for Truth - Interfaith Dialogue
organizer.name: Vahé Jebejian

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Unitarian Universalism is a liberal religion characterized by our free and responsible search for truth and meaning. Thus it is not a religion that tells you what to believe, how to behave, or what God is, but rather strives to encourage its members to answer these questions in their own unique ways. Some say that we are a reformed church that never stopped reforming. We are supported by resources from the Unitarian Universalist Association, European Unitarian Universalists, and the Church of the Larger Fellowship as well as many individual churches and leaders around the world.

In Switzerland, there are UU groups in Geneva and Basel. In Bern, we are not (at this point) forming another congregation, but rather have created a Chalice Circle, that is a small group of individuals who gather once per month. Usually one person sets a theme, chooses an opening and a closing reading, and hosts the meeting. The others are invited to bring questions, songs, thoughts, objects, reading, images, or anything else to create a collective spiritual space. The service is a mix of discussion, silence, listening, and reflection in an improvisational format. No one is required to do anything besides respect the other members but everyone is invited to contribute to and help shape the service. Up until now, we have held all of our services in English, but multilingualism is welcome. We are currently working our way through the UU principles, below, to create a foundation of a shared understanding.

Please visit our website for more information, details, and to get in touch.

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Für alle die interessiert sind mehr über Ansichten, Praxis und Rituale im tibetischen Buddhismus zu erfahren, und wie man diese Praktiken im eigenen Leben anwenden kann.

Wir sind ein tibetisch buddhistisches Zentrum, das der FPMT (foundation for the preservation of Mahayana Buddhism) angehört. Wir stehen unter der Schirmherrschaft von SH Dalai Lama und unser spiritueller Leiter ist Kyabje Zopa Rinpoche.
Wir bieten ein breites Spektrum tibetisch buddhistischer Praktiken, sowie auch Meditationsabende, (Konzentration und Kontemplation), Belehrungen von ordinierten tibetischen und westlichen, sowie auch von Laienlehrern.
Wir sehen es nicht als unsere Aufgabe die Menschen zum Buddhismus zu konvertieren, sondern möchten diese wertvollen und wirksamen Methoden, wie wir unser Herz ohne Angst öffnen können, mit allen teilen die daran interessiert sind.
Alle Anlässe finden auf Spendenbasis statt, und jeder ist willkommen.
name: Bern Tibetan Buddhism Longku FPMT Meetup
organizer.name: Rita Riniker

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Are you searching for meaning in your life?
Have you ever felt happiness in your life...
...never lasts?

This Buddhist group has a great positive, multi-cultural atmosphere that helps people search for the answer to life's biggest questions.
Through the teachings of Buddha and historical Pure Land Buddhist teachers we understand better the direction our life needs to take in order to find the purpose of life.
We offer video lectures and have meetings to discuss how to obtain an absolute form of happiness.
I hope you'll stop by and attend a meeting when you have a chance!

Below, you'll find some more information about what Buddhism is all about as well as our contact info and location.
In Buddhism, we learn that there are two kinds of joy.
Relative Happiness All the happiness we know is called Relative Happiness. Money, status, fame, wealth, family, friends, and our loved ones are all included in this category. Politics, economics, medicine, and the arts also try to provide us with Relative happiness. We seek for this type of happiness day in, day out hoping we can attain true satisfaction from it. Absolute Happiness We are all seeking for a happiness which will truly last. This kind of happiness is called Absolute Happiness. The purpose of life is to attain it as quickly as possible while still alive. Learn more at our meetups and check out some of our topics: The Law of Cause and Effect Six Good Deeds that Bring Happiness Mirror of Truth Dark Mind is the Root Cause of Suffering
name: Zürich The purpose of life in Buddhism Meetup
organizer.name: Nobuaki Kondo

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Jeden Freitag um 19.00 Uhr
Monolith / Andreaskirche, Brahmsstrasse 106, 8003 Zürich
Verpflegungsmöglichkeit ab 18.00 Uhr

Die eindrückliche und moderne Andreaskirche aka Monolith wird an jedem Freitagabend zum speziellen Feierort: In einem zeitgemässen Gottesdienst geht es um dich und um aktuelle Themen, um Gott und die Welt.

Alle sind willkommen – auch immer Familien mit Kindern. Regelmässig werden Gäste eingeladen, Filmausschnitte gezeigt und Diskussionen geführt.

Die Gottesdienste werden von einem Live-Musik-Trio begleitet, das Gospel singt & spielt und mit den Zuschauern mitsingt. Nina Müller, Sängerin, und Javier Fernandez, Pianist, führen zusätzlich an jedem zweiten Dienstag des Monats den Sing-Workshop "The Joy of Singing" durch.

Einfach kommen, eine Kerze anzünden, da sein: vor, während, nach dem Gottesdienst.

Und vielleicht auch darüber hinaus: Bei uns kannst du dich zu Hause fühlen. Wir machen dir Mut, dich mit deinen Wünschen und Ideen einzubringen und etwas zu bewirken.

Du bist Kirche.

Aktuelle Infos auf facebook.com/sihlfeld
Kontakt: feierwerk@sihlfeld.ch
name: FeierWerk: Dein Gottesdienst am Freitagabend

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Lhagsam Study Group Zurich is dedicated to the study and practice of Tibetan Mahayana Buddhism. Our goal is to bring more peace, balance and happiness not only to our own minds, but also to our immediate environment and ultimately to all universal beings. We meet every Tuesday evening in the heart of Zurich for teachings and instructions, guided meditations and group discussions. Our program also includes talks, day-retreats with qualified teachers, and introduction to meditation courses.

We are affiliated with the Foundation for the Preservation of the Mahayana Tradition (FPMT).

Our website: Zürich.fpmt.ch
name: Lhagsam Tibetan Meditation Study Group
organizer.name: Sandra Passardi

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
The world is a vast and magnificent place, inhabited by wonderful beings of various creeds and beliefs, of different hues and shades and who rely on the abundance mother nature for sustenance and are surrounded by beauty.

Despite such beauty and abundance, not everyone has the luxury of a peaceful and beautiful life; a life of peace and fulfillment, free from hunger, fear and desolation.
Today, millions are suffering from man made disasters resulting in environmental catastrophes, others find themselves amidst chaos and confusion created by wars and conflict, and others are swamped by feelings of helplessness, convinced that there is nothing that can be done.

The organizers of this Meetup believe in the power of prayer; especially the power of praying together for a cause. We believe that a joint prayer can bring healing to an ailing world. Thus, we have created this Meetup.

Join us for good conversation on elevated topics, prayer and deepening on spirituality and self improvement.
Organizers are members of the Baha'i Faith but this event is open to all, including in the events relevant readings and texts from all around the world.
Free of charge.
name: Chat, prayer and meditation

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
The world is a vast and magnificent place, inhabited by wonderful beings of various creeds and beliefs, of different hues and shades and who rely on the abundance mother nature for sustenance and are surrounded by beauty.

Despite such beauty and abundance, not everyone has the luxury of a peaceful and beautiful life; a life of peace and fulfillment, free from hunger, fear and desolation.
Today, millions are suffering from man made disasters resulting in environmental catastrophes, others find themselves amidst chaos and confusion created by wars and conflict, and others are swamped by feelings of helplessness, convinced that there is nothing that can be done.

The organizers of this Meetup believe in the power of prayer; especially the power of praying together for a cause. We believe that a joint prayer can bring healing to an ailing world. Thus, we have created this Meetup.

Join us for good conversation on elevated topics, prayer and deepening on spirituality and self improvement.
Organizers are members of the Baha'i Faith but this event is open to all, including in the events relevant readings and texts from all around the world.
Free of charge.
name: Chat, prayer and meditation

category.name: religion/beliefs
description: Are you searching for meaning in your life? Have you ever felt happiness in your life... ...never lasts? This Buddhist group has a great positive, multi-cultural atmosphere that helps people search for the answer to life's biggest questions. Through the teachings of Buddha and historical Pure Land Buddhist teachers we understand better the direction our life needs to take in order to find the purpose of life. We offer video lectures and have meetings to discuss how to obtain an absolute form of happiness. I hope you'll stop by and attend a meeting when you have a chance! Below, you'll find some more information about what Buddhism is all about as well as our contact info and location. In Buddhism, we learn that there are two kinds of joy. Relative Happiness All the happiness we know is called Relative Happiness. Money, status, fame, wealth, family, friends, and our loved ones are all included in this category. Politics, economics, medicine, and the arts also try to provide us with Relative happiness. We seek for this type of happiness day in, day out hoping we can attain true satisfaction from it. Absolute Happiness We are all seeking for a happiness which will truly last. This kind of happiness is called Absolute Happiness. The purpose of life is to attain it as quickly as possible while still alive. Learn more at our meetups and check out some of our topics: The Law of Cause and Effect Six Good Deeds that Bring Happiness Mirror of Truth Dark Mind is the Root Cause of Suffering
name: Lausanne The purpose of life in Buddhism Meetup
organizer.name: Nobuaki Kondo

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Hey guys,

I've had this idea of creating this group of people who have a passion for Truth. It'll be a group where people of all kinds of beliefs, faiths and ideas could join in order to discuss about these issues. I am a Christian but let me be clear that I've lived in 4 different countries, embraced multiple and various cultures. My vision would be to create a group where anyone who has an interest in this subject can come and discuss about these issues openly, and honestly without no one judging them whatsoever.

It's basically promoting interfaith dialogue. It would be amazing to see people from various backgrounds (Muslims, Christians, Atheists, Buddhists, Hindous, Agnostics...) join in to discuss about issues and have a good time over a meal or a drink.

Best,
name: Quest for Truth - Interfaith Dialogue
organizer.name: Vahé Jebejian

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Jeden Freitag um 19.00 Uhr
Monolith / Andreaskirche, Brahmsstrasse 106, 8003 Zürich
Verpflegungsmöglichkeit ab 18.00 Uhr

Die eindrückliche und moderne Andreaskirche aka Monolith wird an jedem Freitagabend zum speziellen Feierort: In einem zeitgemässen Gottesdienst geht es um dich und um aktuelle Themen, um Gott und die Welt.

Alle sind willkommen – auch immer Familien mit Kindern. Regelmässig werden Gäste eingeladen, Filmausschnitte gezeigt und Diskussionen geführt.

Die Gottesdienste werden von einem Live-Musik-Trio begleitet, das Gospel singt & spielt und mit den Zuschauern mitsingt. Nina Müller, Sängerin, und Javier Fernandez, Pianist, führen zusätzlich an jedem zweiten Dienstag des Monats den Sing-Workshop "The Joy of Singing" durch.

Einfach kommen, eine Kerze anzünden, da sein: vor, während, nach dem Gottesdienst.

Und vielleicht auch darüber hinaus: Bei uns kannst du dich zu Hause fühlen. Wir machen dir Mut, dich mit deinen Wünschen und Ideen einzubringen und etwas zu bewirken.

Du bist Kirche.

Aktuelle Infos auf facebook.com/sihlfeld
Kontakt: feierwerk@sihlfeld.ch
name: FeierWerk: Dein Gottesdienst am Freitagabend

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Lhagsam Study Group Zurich is dedicated to the study and practice of Tibetan Mahayana Buddhism. Our goal is to bring more peace, balance and happiness not only to our own minds, but also to our immediate environment and ultimately to all universal beings. We meet every Tuesday evening in the heart of Zurich for teachings and instructions, guided meditations and group discussions. Our program also includes talks, day-retreats with qualified teachers, and introduction to meditation courses.

We are affiliated with the Foundation for the Preservation of the Mahayana Tradition (FPMT).

Our website: Zürich.fpmt.ch
name: Lhagsam Tibetan Meditation Study Group

Die eindrückliche und moderne Andreaskirche aka Monolith wird an jedem Freitagabend zum speziellen Feierort: In einem zeitgemässen Gottesdienst geht es um dich und um aktuelle Themen, um Gott und die Welt.

Du bist Kirche.

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
The world is a vast and magnificent place, inhabited by wonderful beings of various creeds and beliefs, of different hues and shades and who rely on the abundance mother nature for sustenance and are surrounded by beauty.

Despite such beauty and abundance, not everyone has the luxury of a peaceful and beautiful life; a life of peace and fulfillment, free from hunger, fear and desolation.
Today, millions are suffering from man made disasters resulting in environmental catastrophes, others find themselves amidst chaos and confusion created by wars and conflict, and others are swamped by feelings of helplessness, convinced that there is nothing that can be done.

The organizers of this Meetup believe in the power of prayer; especially the power of praying together for a cause. We believe that a joint prayer can bring healing to an ailing world. Thus, we have created this Meetup.

Join us for good conversation on elevated topics, prayer and deepening on spirituality and self improvement.
Organizers are members of the Baha'i Faith but this event is open to all, including in the events relevant readings and texts from all around the world.
Free of charge.

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Are you searching for meaning in your life?
Have you ever felt happiness in your life...
...never lasts?

This Buddhist group has a great positive, multi-cultural atmosphere that helps people search for the answer to life's biggest questions.
Through the teachings of Buddha and historical Pure Land Buddhist teachers we understand better the direction our life needs to take in order to find the purpose of life.
We offer video lectures and have meetings to discuss how to obtain an absolute form of happiness.
I hope you'll stop by and attend a meeting when you have a chance!

Below, you'll find some more information about what Buddhism is all about as well as our contact info and location.
In Buddhism, we learn that there are two kinds of joy.
Relative Happiness All the happiness we know is called Relative Happiness. Money, status, fame, wealth, family, friends, and our loved ones are all included in this category. Politics, economics, medicine, and the arts also try to provide us with Relative happiness. We seek for this type of happiness day in, day out hoping we can attain true satisfaction from it. Absolute Happiness We are all seeking for a happiness which will truly last. This kind of happiness is called Absolute Happiness. The purpose of life is to attain it as quickly as possible while still alive. Learn more at our meetups and check out some of our topics: The Law of Cause and Effect Six Good Deeds that Bring Happiness Mirror of Truth Dark Mind is the Root Cause of Suffering
name: Zürich The purpose of life in Buddhism Meetup

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Our group exists to practice the teachings of the Karma Kagyu tradition of Tibetan Buddhism. The group is part of over 600 centers worldwide and have been inspired and directed by Lama Ole Nydahl. They are under the spiritual guidance of H.H. the 17th Karmapa Trinley Thaye Dorje. 

Our Centers are friendly places where people get an easy access to Buddha’s timeless wisdom, meditate together, share experience and actively participate in the Center activities. We offer daily meditations, meditation courses, retreat places, study courses and lectures by more than 300 international Lay Buddhist Teachers.

 The people you'll meet here are lay (no rules or vows) practitioners with families and jobs who take turns sharing the teachings at public meditations.

Each regular meditation begins with a 20 minute introductory dharma talk and is followed by guided meditation on the Lama. The environment is relaxed and informal and people are welcome to hang out after meditation or come a little earlier. All meetups happen at the Diamond Way Group, Rue de l'Aubépine 3, 6th floor, 1205 Geneva.
Meditations are always free.

For more information visit website: www.bouddhisme.ch
name: Diamond Way Buddhism Meditation Group Geneva
organizer.name: Gretchie Hacquard

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Hey guys,

I've had this idea of creating this group of people who have a passion for Truth. It'll be a group where people of all kinds of beliefs, faiths and ideas could join in order to discuss about these issues. I am a Christian but let me be clear that I've lived in 4 different countries, embraced multiple and various cultures. My vision would be to create a group where anyone who has an interest in this subject can come and discuss about these issues openly, and honestly without no one judging them whatsoever.

It's basically promoting interfaith dialogue. It would be amazing to see people from various backgrounds (Muslims, Christians, Atheists, Buddhists, Hindous, Agnostics...) join in to discuss about issues and have a good time over a meal or a drink.

Best,
name: Quest for Truth - Interfaith Dialogue

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
This year marks the 200th year anniversary of the birth of Baha'u'llah, one of the most influential personalities of our time. The progressive principles he espoused in 19th century Persia moved many individuals to challenge the conceptions of their time and to live a life characterized by disinterested service to their communities. Their endeavours formed the premise of what is now called “social action”.

The political and religious leaders of the time, fearing his influence, exiled him many times with the hope of eliminating his impact. Today, however, inspired by his teachings, millions of people around the world are striving to put his ideals into practice and their efforts are effecting a social change in every sphere of human society.

“The world is but one country and mankind its citizens", he said in one of his most famous quotes. And further, “[l]et your vision be world-embracing, rather than confined to your own self.” Come and find out about a personage whose teachings are contributing to a gradual and significant change in the world. The evening will include an introduction to the life and mission of Baha'u'llah and a film on the concrete actions taken by individuals to bring positive changes to their communities based on his teachings. 

“Let their glorious, peace-bringing, love-creating words and lessons sink into your hearts…”  

- Queen Marie of Romania (1875 – 1938), regarding the teachings of Baha'u'llah

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Our group exists to practice the teachings of the Karma Kagyu tradition of Tibetan Buddhism. The group is part of over 600 centers worldwide and have been inspired and directed by Lama Ole Nydahl. They are under the spiritual guidance of H.H. the 17th Karmapa Trinley Thaye Dorje. 

Our Centers are friendly places where people get an easy access to Buddha’s timeless wisdom, meditate together, share experience and actively participate in the Center activities. We offer daily meditations, meditation courses, retreat places, study courses and lectures by more than 300 international Lay Buddhist Teachers.

 The people you'll meet here are lay (no rules or vows) practitioners with families and jobs who take turns sharing the teachings at public meditations.

Each regular meditation begins with a 20 minute introductory dharma talk and is followed by guided meditation on the Lama. The environment is relaxed and informal and people are welcome to hang out after meditation or come a little earlier. All meetups happen at the Diamond Way Group, Rue de l'Aubépine 3, 6th floor, 1205 Geneva.
Meditations are always free.

For more information visit website: www.bouddhisme.ch
name: Diamond Way Buddhism Meditation Group Geneva
organizer.name: Gretchie Hacquard

category.name: religion/beliefs
description: Are you searching for meaning in your life? Have you ever felt happiness in your life... ...never lasts? This Buddhist group has a great positive, multi-cultural atmosphere that helps people search for the answer to life's biggest questions. Through the teachings of Buddha and historical Pure Land Buddhist teachers we understand better the direction our life needs to take in order to find the purpose of life. We offer video lectures and have meetings to discuss how to obtain an absolute form of happiness. I hope you'll stop by and attend a meeting when you have a chance! Below, you'll find some more information about what Buddhism is all about as well as our contact info and location. In Buddhism, we learn that there are two kinds of joy. Relative Happiness All the happiness we know is called Relative Happiness. Money, status, fame, wealth, family, friends, and our loved ones are all included in this category. Politics, economics, medicine, and the arts also try to provide us with Relative happiness. We seek for this type of happiness day in, day out hoping we can attain true satisfaction from it. Absolute Happiness We are all seeking for a happiness which will truly last. This kind of happiness is called Absolute Happiness. The purpose of life is to attain it as quickly as possible while still alive. Learn more at our meetups and check out some of our topics: The Law of Cause and Effect Six Good Deeds that Bring Happiness Mirror of Truth Dark Mind is the Root Cause of Suffering
name: Lausanne The purpose of life in Buddhism Meetup
organizer.name: Nobuaki Kondo

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Hey guys,

I've had this idea of creating this group of people who have a passion for Truth. It'll be a group where people of all kinds of beliefs, faiths and ideas could join in order to discuss about these issues. I am a Christian but let me be clear that I've lived in 4 different countries, embraced multiple and various cultures. My vision would be to create a group where anyone who has an interest in this subject can come and discuss about these issues openly, and honestly without no one judging them whatsoever.

It's basically promoting interfaith dialogue. It would be amazing to see people from various backgrounds (Muslims, Christians, Atheists, Buddhists, Hindous, Agnostics...) join in to discuss about issues and have a good time over a meal or a drink.

Best,
name: Quest for Truth - Interfaith Dialogue
organizer.name: Vahé Jebejian

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
This year marks the 200th year anniversary of the birth of Baha'u'llah, one of the most influential personalities of our time. The progressive principles he espoused in 19th century Persia moved many individuals to challenge the conceptions of their time and to live a life characterized by disinterested service to their communities. Their endeavours formed the premise of what is now called “social action”.

The political and religious leaders of the time, fearing his influence, exiled him many times with the hope of eliminating his impact. Today, however, inspired by his teachings, millions of people around the world are striving to put his ideals into practice and their efforts are effecting a social change in every sphere of human society.

“The world is but one country and mankind its citizens", he said in one of his most famous quotes. And further, “[l]et your vision be world-embracing, rather than confined to your own self.” Come and find out about a personage whose teachings are contributing to a gradual and significant change in the world. The evening will include an introduction to the life and mission of Baha'u'llah and a film on the concrete actions taken by individuals to bring positive changes to their communities based on his teachings. 

“Let their glorious, peace-bringing, love-creating words and lessons sink into your hearts…”  

- Queen Marie of Romania (1875 – 1938), regarding the teachings of Baha'u'llah
name: Introduction to the Life and Mission of Baha’u’llah

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Are you searching for meaning in your life?
Have you ever felt happiness in your life...
...never lasts?

This Buddhist group has a great positive, multi-cultural atmosphere that helps people search for the answer to life's biggest questions.
Through the teachings of Buddha and historical Pure Land Buddhist teachers we understand better the direction our life needs to take in order to find the purpose of life.
We offer video lectures and have meetings to discuss how to obtain an absolute form of happiness.
I hope you'll stop by and attend a meeting when you have a chance!

Below, you'll find some more information about what Buddhism is all about as well as our contact info and location.
In Buddhism, we learn that there are two kinds of joy.
Relative Happiness All the happiness we know is called Relative Happiness. Money, status, fame, wealth, family, friends, and our loved ones are all included in this category. Politics, economics, medicine, and the arts also try to provide us with Relative happiness. We seek for this type of happiness day in, day out hoping we can attain true satisfaction from it. Absolute Happiness We are all seeking for a happiness which will truly last. This kind of happiness is called Absolute Happiness. The purpose of life is to attain it as quickly as possible while still alive. Learn more at our meetups and check out some of our topics: The Law of Cause and Effect Six Good Deeds that Bring Happiness Mirror of Truth Dark Mind is the Root Cause of Suffering
name: Zürich The purpose of life in Buddhism Meetup
organizer.name: Nobuaki Kondo

category.name: religion/beliefs
description:
Jeden Freitag um 19.00 Uhr
Monolith / Andreaskirche, Brahmsstrasse 106, 8003 Zürich
Verpflegungsmöglichkeit ab 18.00 Uhr

Die eindrückliche und moderne Andreaskirche aka Monolith wird an jedem Freitagabend zum speziellen Feierort: In einem zeitgemässen Gottesdienst geht es um dich und um aktuelle Themen, um Gott und die Welt.

Alle sind willkommen – auch immer Familien mit Kindern. Regelmässig werden Gäste eingeladen, Filmausschnitte gezeigt und Diskussionen geführt.

Die Gottesdienste werden von einem Live-Musik-Trio begleitet, das Gospel singt & spielt und mit den Zuschauern mitsingt. Nina Müller, Sängerin, und Javier Fernandez, Pianist, führen zusätzlich an jedem zweiten Dienstag des Monats den Sing-Workshop "The Joy of Singing" durch.

Einfach kommen, eine Kerze anzünden, da sein: vor, während, nach dem Gottesdienst.

Und vielleicht auch darüber hinaus: Bei uns kannst du dich zu Hause fühlen. Wir machen dir Mut, dich mit deinen Wünschen und Ideen einzubringen und etwas zu bewirken.

Du bist Kirche.

Aktuelle Infos auf facebook.com/sihlfeld
Kontakt: feierwerk@sihlfeld.ch
name: FeierWerk: Dein Gottesdienst am Freitagabend
